page.title: 19Strawberry Fair
page.content: On 29th June Catbrook Parent/Teacher Association held a Strawberry Fair which was one of the most important events in the village this year. There was a fancy dress competition for the children, and a strawberry won the under 8 class and Charlie Chaplin won the over 8 class. A BMX track attracted a group of young cyclists. The winning time was 49 seconds. The children also enjoyed pony rides for lOp. The strawberry tea consisted of fresh strawberries, scones Jersey cream and a cup of tea - all for 5Op. The games included "Wang the Welly", skittles and darts. The stalls were Bottle stall,Gwent Trust for Nature Conservation, ice-cream, cakes and a book and plant stall. Also a raffle was drawn. Altogether the Strawberry Fair was a great success and made about Â£2OO for school funds.
